item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：谷歌即将以 230 亿美元收购网络安全公司 Wiz
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》援引知情人士的话报道，谷歌母公司 Alphabet 公司正在就收购网络安全初创公司 Wiz 进行深入谈判，交易价格可能达到 230 亿美元。【原文：Google parent Alphabet Inc. is in advanced talks to buy cybersecurity startup Wiz in a deal that could fetch $23 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 科威特宣布在近海油田发现 "巨大 "油气田
item.description: 科威特石油公司称，它在一个近海油田发现了 "巨量 "轻质油和伴生气，这标志着其近海碳氢化合物勘探工作的 "转折点"。【原文：Kuwait Oil Co. said it’s discovered “huge commercial amounts” of light oil and associated gas in an offshore field, marking a “turning point” in its efforts to explore offshore hydrocarbons.】

item.title: 瑞士信贷中期审查报告抨击芬马和瑞士央行，SZ 报道
item.description: 据《星期日报》（SonntagsZeitung）报道，瑞士议会委员会对瑞士信贷 2023 年倒闭事件进行了审查，其初步结论对金融监管机构 Finma 以及瑞士中央银行和联邦委员会提出了尖锐批评。【原文：Preliminary conclusions of the Swiss parliamentary commission reviewing the 2023 collapse of Credit Suisse sharply criticize the financial regulator Finma as well as the country’s central bank and the Federal Council, according to a report in SonntagsZeitung.】

item.title: 新兴市场动态：拉尼娜威胁债券收益（播客）
item.description: 新兴市场记者马特-伯吉斯（Matt Burgess）与宋子嘉一起讨论了拉尼娜气候模式来袭时的预期，它可能如何影响发展中国家的通胀、央行决策和降雨量（取决于其严重程度），以及投资者如何在投资组合中做好应对准备。【原文：Emerging markets reporter Matt Burgess joins Zijia Song to discuss what to expect when the La Niña weather pattern hits, how it may impact developing nations’ inflation, central bank decisions and rainfalls depending on its severity, as well as how investors are preparing for it in their portfolios.】

item.title: 拉尼娜影响新兴市场债券回报率
item.description: 新兴市场债券今年以来一直不受青睐，未来几个月将面临另一个威胁：拉尼娜天气现象将推高通胀。【原文：Emerging-market bonds, which have been falling out of favor this year, are set to face another threat in coming months: the La Niña weather phenomenon that’s set to drive up inflation.】

item.title: 金融时报》称高盛质疑美联储压力测试结果
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》报道，高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is appealing its result in the Federal Reserve’s latest stress test, which would require the bank to hold more capital, according to the Financial Times.】

item.title: 桑切斯为埃斯克里瓦在西班牙中央银行的任职资格辩护
item.description: 西班牙首相佩德罗-桑切斯（Pedro Sanchez）为数字转型部长何塞-路易斯-埃斯克里瓦（Jose Luis Escriva）的经济资质进行了有力辩护，尽管他并没有支持埃斯克里瓦担任该国下一任央行行长。【原文：Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez made a strong defense of Digital Transformation Minister Jose Luis Escriva’s economic credentials, although he stopped short of endorsing him as the country’s next central bank governor.】

item.title: 新西兰部分地区被告知周一要做好应对恶劣天气的准备
item.description: 新西兰周一将迎来倾盆大雨和狂风，因此向部分地区发布了恶劣天气警报。【原文：New Zealand issued severe weather warnings for some areas as it braces for heavy downpours and gale-force winds on Monday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚财长称政府将实现第二次盈余
item.description: 据澳大利亚财政部长称，澳大利亚将再次实现数十亿美元的预算盈余，达到 "中位数"。【原文：Australia will deliver a second budget surplus of billions of dollars in the “mid-teens,” according to the nation’s Treasurer.】

item.title: 海文-拉什，枪击案后投资者心目中的 "特朗普交易
item.description: 据市场观察人士称，在前总统唐纳德-特朗普在一次集会上遭枪击后，交易商最初会涌向避险资产，并重新评估与他的候选资格最相关的交易。【原文：Traders will initially rush into haven assets and reevaluate trades most linked to former President Donald Trump’s candidacy after he was shot at a rally, according to market watchers.】

item.title: 比特币上涨，特朗普枪击案被认为增加了连任几率
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普集会发生枪击事件后，比特币正在上涨，人们猜测这一事件将增加他赢得总统大选的机会。【原文：Bitcoin is gaining after the shooting at a Donald Trump rally, leading to speculation the incident will increase his chances of winning the presidential election.】

item.title: 国王演讲聚焦英国新政府推动增长的决心
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）将在即将发表的国王演说中展示新政府为刺激英国经济增长所做的努力。【原文：Prime Minister Keir Starmer will use the upcoming King’s Speech to showcase his new government’s efforts to spur economic growth in the UK.】

item.title: 南非财政部长阐述财政限制与改革
item.description: 南非财政部长伊诺克-戈东瓦纳（Enoch Godongwana）在新组建的联合政府首次举行的闭门会议上概述了国家的财政参数，并制定了从经济改革到投资的优先领域。【原文：South Africa’s Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana outlined the nation’s fiscal parameters as the newly formed coalition government gathered for the first time in a closed-door meeting to map out priority areas from economic reform to investment.】

item.title: 欧洲央行为假期做好准备 五月是九月的黄金市场
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）的官员们可能将为投资者再次降息做好准备，尽管这是在理事会有史以来间隔时间最长的一次夏季休会之后。【原文：European Central Bank officials may be about to prime investors for another interest-rate cut, though only after one of the Governing Council’s longest-ever summer breaks between decisions.】

item.title: 信贷与股票之间的相关性正在瓦解
item.description: 在通胀数据显示物价压力普遍降温之后，信贷市场松了一口气，但经济疲软给企业债务带来了新的风险。【原文：Credit markets are breathing a sigh of relief after inflation data showed price pressures are cooling broadly, but a weakening economy poses fresh risks to corporate debt.】

item.title: 伊拉克就银行和美元限制问题与美国财政部进行谈判
item.description: 伊拉克外交部长福阿德-侯赛因（Fuad Hussein）在国营媒体 al-Iraqiya 播放的新闻发布会上说，伊拉克已在华盛顿与美国财政部的代表进行了讨论，以解决美元限制问题。【原文：Iraq has engaged in discussions in Washington with representatives from the US Treasury to address dollar restriction issues, Iraqi Foreign Minister Fuad Hussein said during a press conference aired on state-run media al-Iraqiya.】

item.title: 卡普托称阿根廷将在平行外汇市场出售美元
item.description: 阿根廷央行将从下周一开始在该国的平行外汇市场出售美元，经济部长路易斯-卡普托（Luis Caputo）称此举是 "货币框架的深化"。【原文：Argentina’s central bank will sell US dollars in the country’s parallel foreign exchange markets starting Monday, a move Economy Minister Luis Caputo called “a deepening of the monetary framework.”】

item.title: 交易员称，比特币 ETF 预示着比特币将不再是长期 "退烧 "代币
item.description: 本周伊始，比特币一路下滑，引发了人们对美国专用交易所交易基金资金外流的担忧。相反，逢低买入比特币的人却涌入现金，一些人认为这种模式预示着比特币的长期波动性将减小。【原文：Bitcoin started the week nursing a slump that stoked fears of outflows from dedicated US exchange-traded funds. Instead dip buyers poured in cash, a pattern that for some points to a less volatile token longer term.】

item.description:

item.title: 财报季拉开帷幕，交易员需关注五大主题
item.description: 随着下周各公司开始公布财报，美股自四月以来的持续反弹面临重大考验。【原文：A non-stop rally in US stocks since April is facing a major test as companies start reporting earnings next week.】

item.title: 伦敦首次公开募股希望者称全面修订上市规则还不够
item.description: 一些最大的私营金融科技公司的首席执行官们正在推动对英国上市规则进行更大胆的改革，他们认为本周宣布的改革措施不足以重振伦敦的股票发行。【原文：Chief executives of some of the largest private financial technology firms are pushing for bolder reforms to the UK’s listing rules, saying an overhaul announced this week doesn’t go far enough to revive London share offerings.】

item.title: 阿达尼计划在越南建设港口以抓住贸易机遇
item.description: 亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）计划在越南建造一个港口，因为这家印度企业集团正寻求在海外发展基础设施，以抓住贸易增长带来的机遇。【原文：Billionaire Gautam Adani plans to build a port in Vietnam as the Indian conglomerate seeks to develop infrastructure overseas to tap opportunities from increasing trade.】

item.title: 日本爱普生首席执行官向共同社透露将缩减海外业务
item.description: 日本制造商精工爱普生公司（Seiko Epson Corp.）首席执行官小川泰典（Yasunori Ogawa）在接受共同社（Kyodo News）采访时表示，该公司计划削减海外员工人数并整合生产基地，以降低成本。【原文：Japanese manufacturer Seiko Epson Corp. plans to reduce its workforce overseas and consolidate production sites in a bid to cut costs, Chief Executive Officer Yasunori Ogawa told Kyodo News in an interview.】

item.title: 波音开始 777X 认证试飞，当前航空公司表示
item.description: 据《时事航空》（The Air Current）报道，波音公司已开始与美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）正式进行777-9的飞行试验，达到了认证的一个里程碑。【原文：Boeing Co. has started to formally conduct flight trials of the 777-9 with the Federal Aviation Administration, reaching a milestone for certification, The Air Current reported.】

item.title: 孟买基础设施投资 35 亿美元缓解交通压力
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）将于周六公布该国金融中心价值超过 2,940 亿卢比（35 亿美元）的项目，这些项目旨在缓解交通拥堵和促进就业。【原文：Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi will unveil projects worth more than 294 billion rupees ($3.5 billion) in the nation’s financial hub on Saturday that are aimed at easing traffic congestion and boosting employment.】

item.title: 斯塔默刺激英国住宅建设的计划中缺少工人的身影
item.description: 首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）承诺 "让英国重新开始建设"，但很快他就会面临技术工人短缺的问题。【原文：Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s promise to “get Britain building again” will quickly face a shortage of skilled workers in the very industries he’s hoping will power the turnaround.】

item.title: 泰国能源大亨在股价创纪录暴跌后面临欺诈指控
item.description: 泰国股市监管机构对 Energy Absolute Pcl 公司首席执行官提出了欺诈和腐败指控，这家陷入困境的可再生能源公司上个月股价暴跌，创下历史新高，导致公司被迫出售创始人作为抵押品的部分股权。【原文：Thailand’s stock market regulator has leveled allegations of fraud and corruption against the chief executive of Energy Absolute Pcl, the embattled renewable energy firm whose shares slumped by a record last month triggering a forced sale of a part of the founder’s stake pledged as collateral.】

item.title: 新加坡人说空调、假期和外出就餐是生活必需品
item.description: 大多数新加坡人表示，拥有智能手机、能够经常外出就餐以及打开空调都是在这个热带、潮湿和昂贵的城市国家生活的必备条件。【原文：A majority of Singaporeans say that having smartphones, being able to dine out regularly, and flipping on the air-conditioning are all must-haves for living in the tropical, humid and expensive city-state.】

item.title: 特许经营集团投资者就收购交易起诉前首席执行官 B. Riley

Riley Financial Inc.，声称股东在该特许零售品牌运营商价值 26 亿美元的私有化收购中被亏空。【原文：Franchise Group Inc. investors sued ex-CEO Brian Kahn and investment partner B. Riley Financial Inc., claiming shareholders were shortchanged in a $2.6 billion take-private buyout of the operator of franchised-retail brands.】
